item.title: Report X-2025061238
item.description:
Report X-2025061238

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-14
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During sort operations at the MEMH location a fiberboard box was found while signs of a release. The fiberboard box contained twelve aerosol cans and the cap of one came off causing the release. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.description:
Report X-2025060919

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-06
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During sort operations at the MEMH location a fiberboard box was discovered with signs of a release. Inside was a 5-gallon plastic jerrycan. The screw cap was loose on the jerrycan causing the release. The shipment was placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report E-2025060189
item.description:
Report E-2025060189

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-03
  • City: ANTIOCH
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 3, 2025, two (2) 1-gallon pails of Interbond 808 Part B were punctured by a forklift and released approximately one and a half (1.5) gallons of product to the loading dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services (HES) to remediate the impacted site. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the loading dock floor. All impacted absorbents were containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum and the damaged pails were placed in one (1) additional 55-gallon drum for future disposal.

Inside of the fiberboard box was a smaller box and a plastic bag containing three paint cans. The lid had opened on one spilling the contents inside of the fiberboard box. All contents of the shipment were place into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report X-2025060171
item.description:
Report X-2025060171

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-24
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Pkg Info ( TRK NBR=439291643445 PKG TYPE=Package (box/drum/jerrican/composite) PHY STATE=No Release TRANSPORTATION PHASE=Loading ) Commodity Info ( UNDG NBR=UN1197 CLASS=30 PSN TEXT=Extracts, liquid PKG GRP=II CONTAINER CAPACITY=11.4 CONTAINER UOM=Liquid - Liter MATERIAL CONSTRUCTION=C - Plastic NUMBER IN SHIPMENT=4 NUMBER FAILED=1 INNER PKG TYPE=2 - Can TOTAL AMT IN EACH CONTAINER=11.4 TOTAL UOM=Liquid - Liter )During sort operations at the MEMH location a fiberboard box was discovered with signs of a release. The shipment contained a plastic jerrycan which was leaking from the cap. This was part of a multi piece shipment and the leaking shipment damaged the fiberboard box of another in the shipment. Both were placed into steel salvage packages and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report X-2025060564
item.description:
Report X-2025060564

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-24
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 5/23/2025 at approximately 2200 hours, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 259484 at the hub facility in Memphis, reporting a dangerous goods spill. The shipment consisted of 6 steel drums overpacked onto a pallet. The shipment appears to have fallen due to a forklift accident resulting in spillage. One of the Class 9 drums and one of the Class 8 drums were compromised and spilled completely. The remainder of the package was rewrapped and awaits an amended shipper's declaration for further transport.

item.title: Report X-2025060164
item.description:
Report X-2025060164

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-24
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 5/23/2025 at approximately 2030 hours, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 749919 at the hub facility in Memphis, reporting a dangerous goods spill. The shipment consisted of 3 fiberboard boxes, each containing 4 glass bottles of perfume. One of which appeared damaged, resulting in spillage. The cause of the damage is unknown. Other 2 packages were successfully delivered, and the unharried pieces of the damaged package were placed in a salvage drum and awaits an amended Shipper's declaration for further transport.

  • Description: Pkg Info ( TRK NBR=457874488220 PKG TYPE=Package (box/drum/jerrican/composite) PHY STATE=Liquid TRANSPORTATION PHASE=Unloading ) Commodity Info ( UNDG NBR=UN1263 CLASS=30 QTY UOM=Liquid - Gallon PSN TEXT=Paint Related Material PKG GRP=II SPILLED QTY=0 CONTAINER CAPACITY=1 CONTAINER UOM=Liquid - Gallon MATERIAL CONSTRUCTION=A - Metal (any type) NUMBER IN SHIPMENT=1 NUMBER FAILED=0 INNER PKG TYPE=1 - Bottle TOTAL AMT IN EACH CONTAINER=1 TOTAL UOM=Liquid - Gallon )Spill. Undeclared hazmat: no DOT labels or markings. 1 gallon lost from 1gal metal can Summit Racing 2.1VOC High Build Primer in Gray/Silver, SUM-LVSP314G, no paint can clips. Also included: 1gal SWBC500, 1gal SWBR575G, 1gal SWSC620G, 1qt SWSH612Q, 1qt LVSH320Q - Summit Racing paint, reducers, and hardeners. Flashpoints are 12, 20, 30, 32, 111, and 135 in Fahrenheit. All content soiled.

item.title: Report E-2025050484
item.description:
Report E-2025050484

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-22
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 3500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Hepaco was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractors arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 4in-by-4in area of the concrete dock floor and estimated that six (6) ounces of material were released due to a damaged valve and puncture in one (1) 2583-pound metal tote. Hepaco personnel determined a tote transfer would be needed. Hepaco wiped down the tote and started the tote transfer. They used a gravity transfer for the tote transfer to one (1) poly tote. No waste was generated from the cleanup or the tote transfer. Hepaco personnel staged the new tote on-site and set aside the damaged tote for Dayton to send back to the shipper, INX Lebanon.

item.title: Report X-2025051617
item.description:
Report X-2025051617

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-14
  • City: CORDOVA
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On May 13th during the PM sort a package was discovered at the origin station with the words Tuff Stuff Multi-purpose cleaner on the outside of the package along with what appeared to be a taped piece of cardboard on another side. After peeling back that cardboard a ground limited quantity label was found underneath. The package contained twelve 22oz aerosol cans containing Tuff Stuff Multi-purpose cleaner. The package had no DG markings or and labels for UN1950 Aerosols, flammable 2.1 or a shipper's declaration of dangerous goods. The package is being held at the station pending FAA investigation.

  • City: NASHVILLE

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 2356ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal BNA. It was reported that approximately 1-oz of " ConvoClean Forte" released from 5 cardboard boxes due to unknown reasons. The release impacted inside of trailer #3191178. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and recommended a contractor for cleanup, XPO felt comfortable cleaning up the spill. XPO will place the waste inside of a 30-gallan poly drum. ERTS generated waste ID 236368-1.
